isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SINGLE SPEED AXLE: SPICER - ASSEMBLE - DIFFERENTIAL

step1.para: If ring gear was removed from differential case, re-install at this time. Bolt ring gear to differential case in two places, 180 degrees apart, before compressing rivet; this will eliminate ring gear runout. Use hydraulic press and suitable riveting fixture ( Figure 49). Pressure requirement per rivet is 45 to 50 U.S. tons (41 to 45 metric tons).

note.para: Ring gear and pinion must be replaced as a matched set only.

step1.para: Install bearing cones to differential case halves. Place bearing cups on cones during remainder of assembly to prevent damage to bearings ( Figure 50).

figure.caption: Figure 50. Place Bearing Cups on Cones

note.para: Use of press and proper adapter is preferred to eliminate possible damage to bearings.

step1.para: Apply a small amount of gear lubricant to all mating surfaces. This will aid in assembly by keeping parts together and providing initial lubrication.
Place thrust washer and side gear in left hand differential case ( Figure 51).

figure.caption: Figure 51. Place Thrust Washer and Side Gear in Left Hand Differential Case

step1.para: Assemble differential pinions and thrust washers on cross shaft. Place assembly in left hand differential case ( Figure 52).

figure.caption: Figure 52. Place Assembly in Left Hand Differential Case

step1.para: Place remaining side gear and thrust washers in position on differential pinions ( Figure 53).

figure.caption: Figure 53. Place Remaining Side Gear and Thrust Washers in Position

step1.para: Assemble case halves, making sure match marks are lined up ( Figure 54).

note.para: If case halves were not match marked, align the quadrants that have the three machined holes.

step1.para:
Install differential case bolts and nuts; tighten alternately and evenly. Refer to the TORQUE CHART
, for proper fastener torque ( Figure 55).
After minimum torque specification is achieved, continue to tighten nut until flat of hex is parallel with outside diameter of differential case ( Figure 56).

figure.caption: Figure 56. Continue to Tighten Nut Until Flat of Hex is Parallel With Outside Diameter of Differential Case
